repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This PR implements the minimal snippet feature.

### API

- `vim.snippet.expand(snippet_text)`
- `vim.snippet.jump(direction)`
- `vim.snippet.jumpable(direction)`
- `vim.snippet.dispose()`

### Limitation
- current implementation can't handle adjacent placeholders.
- the `transform` feature is just ignored.

### TODO
- functionaltest
    - port test case from vim-vsnip
- documentation
    - learn how to write docs

comment_data.body:
In my desing, the `vim.snippet` will be this `M`.

The plugin authors can override `vim.snippet.expand` or `vim.snippet.jump`.

Probably, we should expose `vim.snippet.jumpable(direction)`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,200 @@
+local snippet = require('vim.lsp._snippet')
+
+---@type { session: nvim.SnippetSession }
+local state = {}
+
+---Return one indent string of current buffer.
+---@return string
+local function get_one_indent()
+  local expandtab = vim.api.nvim_get_option('expandtab')
+  if not expandtab then
+    return '\t'
+  end
+  local shiftwidth = vim.api.nvim_get_option('shiftwidth')
+  if shiftwidth > 0 then
+    return string.rep(' ', shiftwidth)
+  end
+  return string.rep(' ', vim.api.nvim_get_option('tabstop'))
+end
+
+---Return base indent of current line.
+---@return string
+local function get_base_indent()
+  return string.match(vim.api.nvim_get_current_line(), '^%s*') or ''
+end
+
+---Select specific range.
+---@param range { s: { number, number }, e: { number, number } }
+local function select_text(range)
+  if range.s[1] == range.e[1] and range.s[2] == range.e[2] then
+    vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, { range.s[1] + 1, range.s[2] })
+  else
+    vim.api.nvim_feedkeys(vim.api.nvim_replace_termcodes([[<Esc>%sG%s|v%sG%s|<C-g>]], true, true, true):format(
+      range.s[1] + 1,
+      range.s[2] + 1,
+      range.e[1] + 1,
+      range.e[2]
+    ), 'n', true)
+  end
+end
+
+---Adjust snippet indent
+---@param snippet_text string
+---@return string
+local function adjust_indent(snippet_text)
+  local one_indent = get_one_indent()
+  local base_indent = get_base_indent()
+  local adjusted_snippet_text = {}
+  local texts = vim.split(snippet_text, '\n', true)
+  for i, text in ipairs(texts) do
+    if i ~= #texts and string.match(text, '^%s*$') then
+      table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, '')
+    else
+      if i ~= 1 then
+        text = string.gsub(text, '^(\t+)', function(indent)
+          return string.gsub(indent, '\t', one_indent)
+        end)
+        table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, base_indent .. text)
+      else
+        table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, text)
+      end
+    end
+  end
+  return table.concat(adjusted_snippet_text, '\n')
+end
+
+---@class nvim.SnippetSession
+---@field ns string
+---@field public snippet_text string
+local SnippetSession = {}
+
+---Create SnippetSession instance.
+---@param snippet_text string
+function SnippetSession.new(snippet_text)
+  return setmetatable({
+    ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('nvim.snippet'),
+    snippet_text = adjust_indent(snippet_text),
+  }, { __index = SnippetSession })
+end
+
+---Insert snippet to the current buffer.
+function SnippetSession:insert()
+  local cursor = vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0)
+  cursor[1] = cursor[1] - 1
+
+  local snippet_node = snippet.parse(self.snippet_text)
+  vim.api.nvim_buf_set_text(0, cursor[1], cursor[2], cursor[1], cursor[2], vim.split(tostring(snippet_node), '\n'))
+
+  local function traverse(node, start_pos)
+    local end_pos = { start_pos[1], start_pos[2] }
+    local marks = {}
+    if node.children then
+      for _, child in ipairs(node.children) do
+        for _, mark in ipairs(traverse(child, end_pos)) do
+          table.insert(marks, mark)
+        end
+      end
+    else
+      local texts = vim.split(tostring(node), '\n')
+      end_pos[1] = start_pos[1] + #texts - 1
+      end_pos[2] = #texts == 1 and (start_pos[2] + #texts[1]) or #texts[#texts]
+    end
+
+    if vim.tbl_contains({
+      snippet.NodeType.TABSTOP,
+      snippet.NodeType.PLACEHOLDER,
+      snippet.NodeType.CHOICE,
+    }, node.type) then
+      table.insert(marks, {
+        mark_id = vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, self.ns, start_pos[1], start_pos[2], {
+          end_line = end_pos[1],
+          end_col = end_pos[2],
+          hl_group = 'Visual',
+        }),
+        node = node,
+      })
+    end
+
+    start_pos[1] = end_pos[1]
+    start_pos[2] = end_pos[2]
+
+    return marks
+  end
+  self.marks = traverse(snippet_node, cursor)
+end
+
+local M = {}

comment_data.body: The default minimal snippet implementation is this.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

+
+---@type { session: nvim.SnippetSession }
+local state = {}
+

comment_data.body:
This `M` will be a `vim.snippet`.

The plugin authors can override `vim.snippet.expand` and `vim.snippet.jump`.

Probably, we should expose `vim.snippet.jumpable(direction)`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,212 @@
+local snippet = require('vim.lsp._snippet')
+
+---@type { session: nvim.SnippetSession }
+local state = {}
+
+---Return one indent string of current buffer.
+---@return string
+local function get_one_indent()
+  local expandtab = vim.api.nvim_get_option('expandtab')
+  if not expandtab then
+    return '\t'
+  end
+  local shiftwidth = vim.api.nvim_get_option('shiftwidth')
+  if shiftwidth > 0 then
+    return string.rep(' ', shiftwidth)
+  end
+  return string.rep(' ', vim.api.nvim_get_option('tabstop'))
+end
+
+---Return base indent of current line.
+---@return string
+local function get_base_indent()
+  return string.match(vim.api.nvim_get_current_line(), '^%s*') or ''
+end
+
+---Select specific range.
+---@param range { s: { number, number }, e: { number, number } }
+local function select_text(range)
+  if range.s[1] == range.e[1] and range.s[2] == range.e[2] then
+    vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, { range.s[1] + 1, range.s[2] })
+  else
+    vim.api.nvim_feedkeys(vim.api.nvim_replace_termcodes([[<Esc>%sG%s|v%sG%s|<C-g>]], true, true, true):format(
+      range.s[1] + 1,
+      range.s[2] + 1,
+      range.e[1] + 1,
+      range.e[2]
+    ), 'in', true)
+  end
+end
+
+---Adjust snippet indent
+---@param snippet_text string
+---@return string
+local function adjust_indent(snippet_text)
+  local one_indent = get_one_indent()
+  local base_indent = get_base_indent()
+  local adjusted_snippet_text = {}
+  local texts = vim.split(snippet_text, '\n', true)
+  for i, text in ipairs(texts) do
+    if i ~= #texts and string.match(text, '^%s*$') then
+      table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, '')
+    else
+      if i ~= 1 then
+        text = string.gsub(text, '^(\t+)', function(indent)
+          return string.gsub(indent, '\t', one_indent)
+        end)
+        table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, base_indent .. text)
+      else
+        table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, text)
+      end
+    end
+  end
+  return table.concat(adjusted_snippet_text, '\n')
+end
+
+---@alias nvim.SnippetJumpDirection "1" | "2"
+local JumpDirection = {}
+JumpDirection.Next = 1
+JumpDirection.Prev = 2
+
+
+---@class nvim.SnippetSession
+---@field ns string
+---@field public snippet_text string
+local SnippetSession = {}
+
+---Create SnippetSession instance.
+---@param snippet_text string
+function SnippetSession.new(snippet_text)
+  return setmetatable({
+    ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('nvim.snippet'),
+    snippet_text = adjust_indent(snippet_text),
+  }, { __index = SnippetSession })
+end
+
+---Insert snippet to the current buffer.
+function SnippetSession:expand()
+  local cursor = vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0)
+  cursor[1] = cursor[1] - 1
+
+  local snippet_node = snippet.parse(self.snippet_text)
+  vim.api.nvim_buf_set_text(0, cursor[1], cursor[2], cursor[1], cursor[2], vim.split(tostring(snippet_node), '\n'))
+
+  local function traverse(node, start_pos)
+    local end_pos = { start_pos[1], start_pos[2] }
+    local marks = {}
+    if node.children then
+      for _, child in ipairs(node.children) do
+        for _, mark in ipairs(traverse(child, end_pos)) do
+          table.insert(marks, mark)
+        end
+      end
+    else
+      local texts = vim.split(tostring(node), '\n')
+      end_pos[1] = start_pos[1] + #texts - 1
+      end_pos[2] = #texts == 1 and (start_pos[2] + #texts[1]) or #texts[#texts]
+    end
+
+    if vim.tbl_contains({
+      snippet.NodeType.TABSTOP,
+      snippet.NodeType.PLACEHOLDER,
+      snippet.NodeType.CHOICE,
+    }, node.type) then
+      table.insert(marks, {
+        mark_id = vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, self.ns, start_pos[1], start_pos[2], {
+          end_line = end_pos[1],
+          end_col = end_pos[2],
+          hl_group = 'Visual',
+        }),
+        node = node,
+      })
+    end
+
+    start_pos[1] = end_pos[1]
+    start_pos[2] = end_pos[2]
+
+    return marks
+  end
+  self.marks = traverse(snippet_node, cursor)
+end
+
+---Jump to the suitable placeholder.
+---@param direction nvim.SnippetJumpDirection
+function SnippetSession:jump(direction)
+  local is_correct_direction = function(cursor, current_range)
+    if direction == JumpDirection.Next then
+      return current_range.s[1] < cursor[1] or (current_range.s[1] == cursor[1] and cursor[2] < current_range.s[2])
+    end
+    return current_range.s[1] > cursor[1] or (current_range.s[1] == cursor[1] and cursor[2] > current_range.s[2])
+  end
+  local compare = function(cursor, target_range, current_range)
+    local is_nearest = not target_range
+    if direction == JumpDirection.Next then
+      is_nearest = is_nearest or (math.abs(target_range.s[1] - cursor[1]) > math.abs(current_range.s[1] - cursor[1]))
+      is_nearest = is_nearest or (target_range.s[1] == current_range.s[1] and math.abs(target_range.s[2] - cursor[2]) > math.abs(current_range.s[2] - cursor[2]))
+    else
+      is_nearest = is_nearest or (math.abs(target_range.s[1] - cursor[1]) < math.abs(current_range.s[1] - cursor[1]))
+      is_nearest = is_nearest or (target_range.s[1] == current_range.s[1] and math.abs(target_range.s[2] - cursor[2]) < math.abs(current_range.s[2] - cursor[2]))
+    end
+    return is_nearest
+  end
+
+  local cursor = vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0)
+  cursor[1] = cursor[1] - 1
+
+  local target_range
+  for _, m in ipairs(state.session.marks or {}) do
+    local mark = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_extmark_by_id(0, state.session.ns, m.mark_id, { details = true })
+    local s = { mark[1], mark[2] }
+    local e = { mark[3].end_row, mark[3].end_col }
+    if s[1] > e[1] or (s[1] == e[1] and s[2] > e[2]) then
+      local t = s
+      s = e
+      e = t
+    end
+    local current_range = { s = s, e = e }
+    if is_correct_direction(cursor, current_range) then
+      if compare(cursor, target_range, current_range) then
+        target_range = current_range
+      end
+    end
+  end
+  if target_range then
+    select_text(target_range)
+  end
+end
+
+local M = {}

comment_data.body:
This implementation does not care about the `current tabstop index`. Instead of that, this determines the suitable next tabstop via `cursor position`.

This is not general implementation. I think we should implement correct version if we ship this PR.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,212 @@
+local snippet = require('vim.lsp._snippet')
+
+---@type { session: nvim.SnippetSession }
+local state = {}
+
+---Return one indent string of current buffer.
+---@return string
+local function get_one_indent()
+  local expandtab = vim.api.nvim_get_option('expandtab')

+  if shiftwidth > 0 then

+  return string.rep(' ', vim.api.nvim_get_option('tabstop'))
+end

+      range.s[1] + 1,

+    ), 'in', true)

+end
+
+---Adjust snippet indent

+---@return string

+  local base_indent = get_base_indent()
+  local adjusted_snippet_text = {}
+  local texts = vim.split(snippet_text, '\n', true)
+  for i, text in ipairs(texts) do
+    if i ~= #texts and string.match(text, '^%s*$') then
+      table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, '')
+    else
+      if i ~= 1 then

+          return string.gsub(indent, '\t', one_indent)
+        end)
+        table.insert(adjusted_snippet_text, base_indent .. text)

+    end

+  return table.concat(adjusted_snippet_text, '\n')

+
+
+---@class nvim.SnippetSession

+    snippet_text = adjust_indent(snippet_text),

+end
+
+---Insert snippet to the current buffer.

comment_data.body:
Currently, this will insert the result of `tostring(snippet_ast)`.
It should be changed when implementing LSP variables.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

+---Insert snippet to the current buffer.
+function SnippetSession:expand()
+  local cursor = vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0)
+  cursor[1] = cursor[1] - 1
+
+  local snippet_node = snippet.parse(self.snippet_text)
+  vim.api.nvim_buf_set_text(0, cursor[1], cursor[2], cursor[1], cursor[2], vim.split(tostring(snippet_node), '\n'))

@@ -0,0 +1,106 @@
+local helpers = require('test.functional.helpers')(after_each)
+
+local eq = helpers.eq
+local clear = helpers.clear
+local feed = helpers.feed
+local exec_lua = helpers.exec_lua
+
+describe('vim.snippet', function()
+  before_each(function()
+    helpers.clear()
+    exec_lua([[
+      function getpos()
+        local cur = vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0)
+        return { cur[1] - 1, cur[2] }
+      end
+    ]])
+  end)
+
+  after_each(function()
+    helpers.clear()
+  end)
+
+  it('should expand snippet with considering buffer indent setting', function()
+    local snippet = table.concat({
+      'class ${1:Class}${2: extends ${3:Parent}} {',
+      '\tpublic $1($4) {',
+      '\t\t${5}',
+      '\t}',
+      '}',
+      ''
+    }, '\n')
+
+    for _, case in ipairs({
+      {
+        base_indent = [[  ]],
+        indent_setting = [[
+          vim.o.expandtab = true
+          vim.o.shiftwidth = 2
+        ]],
+        expects = {
+          '  class Class extends Parent {',
+          '    public Class() {',
+          '      ',
+          '    }',
+          '  }',
+          '  ',
+        }
+      }, {
+        base_indent = [[  ]],
+        indent_setting = [[
+          vim.o.expandtab = true
+          vim.o.shiftwidth = 0
+          vim.o.tabstop = 2
+        ]],
+        expects = {
+          '  class Class extends Parent {',
+          '    public Class() {',
+          '      ',
+          '    }',
+          '  }',
+          '  ',
+        }
+      }, {
+        base_indent = [[<Tab>]],
+        indent_setting = [[
+          vim.o.expandtab = false
+        ]],
+        expects = {
+          '\tclass Class extends Parent {',
+          '\t\tpublic Class() {',
+          '\t\t\t',
+          '\t\t}',
+          '\t}',
+          '\t',
+        }
+      }
+    }) do
+      clear()
+      exec_lua(case.indent_setting)
+      feed('i' .. case.base_indent)
+      exec_lua('vim.snippet.expand(...)', snippet)
+      eq(case.expects, helpers.buf_lines(0))
+    end
+  end)
+
+  -- This test doesn't work as expected due to feedkeys (maybe).

comment_data.body:
How do I write test for this?

I can't manage `vim.schedule` and `feedkeys`...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,259 @@
+local helpers = require('test.functional.helpers')(after_each)
+
+local eq = helpers.eq
+local clear = helpers.clear
+local feed = helpers.feed
+local exec_lua = helpers.exec_lua
+
+describe('vim.snippet', function()
+  before_each(function()
+    clear()
+    exec_lua([[
+      vim.snippet.dispose()
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 'n', '<C-l>', '<Cmd>lua vim.snippet.sync()<CR>', { noremap = true })
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 'i', '<C-l>', '<Cmd>lua vim.snippet.sync()<CR>', { noremap = true })
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 's', '<C-l>', '<Cmd>lua vim.snippet.sync()<CR>', { noremap = true })
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 'i', '<Tab>', '<Cmd>lua vim.snippet.jump(vim.snippet.JumpDirection.Next)<CR>', { noremap = true })
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 's', '<Tab>', '<Cmd>lua vim.snippet.jump(vim.snippet.JumpDirection.Next)<CR>', { noremap = true })
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 'i', '<S-Tab>', '<Cmd>lua vim.snippet.jump(vim.snippet.JumpDirection.Prev)<CR>', { noremap = true })
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 's', '<S-Tab>', '<Cmd>lua vim.snippet.jump(vim.snippet.JumpDirection.Prev)<CR>', { noremap = true })
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(0, 's', '<BS>', '"\\<BS>" .. (getcurpos()[2] == col("$") - 1 ? "a" : "i")', { noremap = true, expr = true })
+
+      function get_state()
+        local m = vim.api.nvim_get_mode().mode
+        local s = vim.fn.getpos("'<")
+        local e = vim.fn.getpos("'>")
+        local c = vim.fn.getpos('.')
+        return {
+          m = m,
+          s = m ~= 's' and ({ c[2] - 1, c[3] - 1 }) or ({ s[2] - 1, s[3] - 1 }),
+          e = m ~= 's' and ({ c[2] - 1, c[3] - 1 }) or ({ e[2] - 1, e[3] - 1 }),
+        }
+      end
+    ]])
+  end)
+  after_each(function()
+    clear()
+  end)
+
+  it('should expand snippet with considering buffer indent setting', function()
+    local snippet = table.concat({
+      'class ${1:ClassName} {',
+      '\tpublic $1($2) {',
+      '\t\t${3}',
+      '\t}',
+      '}',
+      ''
+    }, '\n')
+
+    for _, case in ipairs({
+      {
+        base_indent = [[  ]],
+        indent_setting = [[
+          vim.o.expandtab = true
+          vim.o.shiftwidth = 2
+        ]],
+        expects = {
+          '  class ClassName {',
+          '    public ClassName() {',
+          '      ',
+          '    }',
+          '  }',
+          '  ',
+        }
+      }, {
+        base_indent = [[  ]],
+        indent_setting = [[
+          vim.o.expandtab = true
+          vim.o.shiftwidth = 0
+          vim.o.tabstop = 2
+        ]],
+        expects = {
+          '  class ClassName {',
+          '    public ClassName() {',
+          '      ',
+          '    }',
+          '  }',
+          '  ',
+        }
+      }, {
+        base_indent = [[<Tab>]],
+        indent_setting = [[
+          vim.o.expandtab = false
+        ]],
+        expects = {
+          '\tclass ClassName {',
+          '\t\tpublic ClassName() {',
+          '\t\t\t',
+          '\t\t}',
+          '\t}',
+          '\t',
+        }
+      }
+    }) do
+      clear()
+      exec_lua(case.indent_setting)
+      feed('i' .. case.base_indent)
+      exec_lua('vim.snippet.expand(...)', snippet)
+      eq(case.expects, helpers.buf_lines(0))
+    end
+  end)
+
+  it('should able to jump to all placeholders', function()
+    exec_lua('vim.snippet.expand(...)', table.concat({
+      'class ${1:ClassName} {',
+      '\tpublic $1($2) {',
+      '\t\t${3}',
+      '\t}',
+      '}',
+      ''
+    }, '\n'))
+    local cases = {
+      { m = 's', s = { 0, 6 }, e = { 0, 14 }, },
+      { m = 'i', s = { 1, 18 }, e = { 1, 18 }, },
+      { m = 'i', s = { 2, 2 }, e = { 2, 2 }, },
+      { m = 'i', s = { 5, 0 }, e = { 5, 0 }, },
+    }
+    for i = 1, #cases do
+      eq(cases[i], exec_lua([[return get_state()]]))
+      eq(i ~= #cases, exec_lua([[return vim.snippet.jumpable(vim.snippet.JumpDirection.Next)]]))
+      feed('<Tab>')
+    end
+    eq(cases[#cases], exec_lua([[return get_state()]]))
+    for i = #cases, 1, -1 do
+      eq(cases[i], exec_lua([[return get_state()]]))
+      eq(i ~= 1, exec_lua([[return vim.snippet.jumpable(vim.snippet.JumpDirection.Prev)]]))
+      feed('<S-Tab>')
+    end
+    eq(cases[1], exec_lua([[return get_state()]]))
+  end)
+
+  it('should sync same tabstop marks', function()
+    exec_lua('vim.snippet.expand(...)', table.concat({
+      'class ${1:ClassName} {',
+      '\tpublic $1($2) {',
+      '\t\t${3}',
+      '\t}',
+      '}',
+      ''
+    }, '\n'))
+    feed('ModifiedClassName<C-l>')
+    eq({
+      'class ModifiedClassName {',
+      '\tpublic ModifiedClassName() {',
+      '\t\t',
+      '\t}',
+      '}',
+      '',
+    }, helpers.buf_lines(0))
+  end)
+

+  --   }, '\n'))

+  -- end)

comment_regular_data.body:
the `adjacent placeholder` is difficult to support via extmarks API, I guess.

I don't think the core needs to support such difficult cases. How about that?
Hm... the gravity management is bit hard. I'll investigate it...
Hmm ... undo complex extmarks don't restore state correctly, I guess

I'd say the _minimal_ snippet API we should support is what is required for LSP completion snippets to work -- and no more. So if these features are not used by the LSP spec, we should not implement them.

Of course, a "nested" situation can also occur if an LSP snippet is expanded inside a user snippet -- but then the user must already be using a full snippet plugin, which should also take care of LSP snippets and so this is the full plugin's problem. (We should not support mixing different snippet engines!)

Thank you for your response.
OK. I'll make the implementation more simple.
Oh, I'm not saying you have to remove stuff! Just don't mind about adding such complicated things that are not strictly necessary.

Yes. I think the required features are

1. undo management
2. Support editing non-origin mark directly

Currently, my implementation cares about the adjacent placeholders. I'll remove it for now. (If we re-consider it's required, we can implement it later)
@hrsh7th do you mind me asking what are your current plans for this?

I'd like to continue implementing this, but I'm too busy to do it at the moment.

I'm also planning on reworking the completion plugin, so I'm not sure how to prioritize this PR.

Everyone uses LuaSnip, so it was a little less of a priority.
I think I'll raise the priority again and think about it.

> Everyone uses LuaSnip, so it was a little less of a priority.
> I think I'll raise the priority again and think about it.

Just to be clear: it is still a very high priority for Neovim to be able to expand LSP snippets (e.g., in omni-completion, or using `nvim-cmp`) without an external plugin. We consider this a requirement for claiming to fully support the LSP specification, which is an explicit goal.

(We also hope to be able to expose these methods to users wanting to write their own full-featured snippet plugin that can work with a personal snippet library and manual expansion, but this is secondary.)

This functionality would be very useful for me.

I'm writing a project in Dart / Flutter  a mobile app  which requires sticking together a lot of "widgets" that each have a million props to configure.

The omnifunc completes props so I don't have to remember exactly what attributes are owned by whichever widget. However, _built into_ the ordinary completion, for ordinary tokens, in the Dart LSP is snippet functionality.

A regular completion on "co" inside a Container object would produce "color: ,"  adding a colon, a space, and appending a trailing comma. The idea is for the cursor to be placed before the comma so you can just insert whatever object is required by the class property (attribute), and it's all syntactically correct. However, because the Omnifunc doesn't have any support for snippet-like behaviour, it ignores the added information from the language server, and just places the cursor after the comma. Meaning I have to either delete the comma and re-enter it later, or go into normal mode to backtrack.

Likewise, trying to complete certain class names auto-fills all their properties, but you have no way to tab between them and edit them, because no snippets. This is all in the base LSP completions and no snippet plugin is going to be able to override that.

Not complaining, just throwing in my 2 cents about why this would be extremely, extremely welcome for certain users! How's the PR, shall I just merge it in my local copy and see how it goes?
any news on this pr? won't be part of 0.10 milestone?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(snippet): Minimal snippet API
